item.title: Waste container from 219 Southborough Lane blocking pavement, 16th October
item.description:
Waste Container has been blocking pavement all week from Village Wine 219 Southborough Lane. I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///grab.atoms.hills https://w3w.co/grab.atoms.hills

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 213, Southborough Lane, Bickley, London

item.title: Dangerous, 16th October
item.description:
On Tuesday the traffic lights had engineers working on them , since then they have changed the time in which the red stop light stays on , it is causing idiot drivers to go through the red light as they think its to long , many very close accidents yesterday with cars bikes and pedestrians and the same is happening today
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leinster Terrace, Bayswater, London

item.description:

item.title: Urination by bus stops, 16th October
item.description:
Please help solve the problem of the public urinating by the two bus stops at the top of Anerley Hill. The gate was left open briefly and someone has urinated on the drive as can be seen in the pic. Park goers and neighbours will often witness men using the park opposite to urinate in too. Peeing in public is against the law. Due to the heavy use of these bus stops it is a common occurrence. Can the driveway please be cleaned as if the bus stop wasn’t there no one would have peed on the drive. Is there a good long term solution that solves this without ruining the ambience and green wholesome vibe of the park opposite or the area by the bus stop outside our home? Keen to hear what solutions might be available that will help rather than hinder this issue. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin broken, but also too small., 16th October
item.description:
I believe this site is managed by better, but amunsure as to the bin ownership. One of the bins is broken as per the picture but there is also insufficient bin capacity in this area, and the bins are frequently full, will excess rubbish being scattered nearby. Might this be an opportunity to replace the existing small bins with larger ones? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartmouth Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burst water main at junction with Venture Close c, 16th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Elmwood Drive, Bexley, London
